body_content.explanation: a Russian or Ukrainian pie made with a pastry container filled with savoury or sweet food:
examples: The book gives an introduction to Russia's best-known dishes, including pirogi and blinis.
The Ukrainian diner has fantastic broccoli and cheese pirogis.
Cook the pirog in the oven for 10-15 minutes.
Pirogs have always been an important part of Russian festivities.

body_content.explanation: a Polish dumpling (= a type of pastry filled with savoury or sweet food) that is boiled and may also be fried:
examples: Restaurants serve up platters of pirogis.
Every wheat-growing nation has its own version of pasta - udon in Japan, pirogi in Poland.
